abstracts.cdata!:
The Flood Emergency Rehabilitation
            Project had a satisfactory outcome, likely sustainability,
            substantial institutional development impact, and
            satisfactory performances by both Bank and Borrower. Factors
            affecting the project included worse than expected
            conditions, while climatic conditions, the presence of land
            mines in some sections of the roads, and other international
            political events also affected the pace of project
            implementation. Factors subject to government control
            included coordination issues, early insufficient commitment
            and senior-level attention, and approval delays.  Factors
            subject to implementing agency control included: lack of
            coordination and collaboration, administrative delays in
            decision making, delays in the hiring of consultants, and
            under-estimating the cost for rehabilitating individual
            sub-projects.  The following lessons were learned: (a) Civil
            works restoration projects require adequate programs for
            capacity building in the implementing agencies; (b) The
            project was hampered by the lack of a list of sub-projects
            identified through field visits; (c) Availability of
            agricultural extension services is crucial to both poverty
            alleviation and sustainable operation and maintenance for
            irrigation facilities rehabilitated under the project; (d)
            The early planning was insufficient to ensure project
            sustainability;  (e) Community contracting under the schools
            component with a participatory approach has been proved to
            be the most efficient means of procurement for large numbers
            of schools to be constructed simultaneously over
            geographically dispersed areas; (f) Generally, more time
            should be spent estimating project costs; (g) Even an
            emergency project benefits from an explicit, well-prepared
            logical framework.
